div.p: SHORT Queſtions and anſweres to be learned of ſuch as be Ignorant, before they be admitted to the Lords ſupper.
Whereunto are added certain obſeruations neceſſarie to be vſed of euerie Chriſtian.
By Giles Whiting.
LONDON, Printed by Thomas Orwin, for Robert Dexter. 1593.

div.head: Short queſtions and anſweres, to be learned of ſuch as be ignorant; before they be admitted to the Lords Supper.
div.p: WHat Religion doe you profeſſe? Chriſtian Religion.Act. 11. 26.
What is Chriſtian Religion? It is the true profeſſion, beleeuing,Rom 10 9. 1 • Act. 4. 12. and following of thoſe things, which are commanded and taught vs by God in the holy Scriptures.
What call you the holy Scriptures? The word of God contained in the bookes2. Tim. 3. 16. of the old and new teſtament.
Doth this Scripture or word of God containe in it all poynts of true Religion, and euerie thing neceſſarie for the ſaluation of a Christian? Yea.
Tell me then from this Scripture, how many 2. Tim 3. 16. 17. Deut. 4. 35. 8 • 6. 4 Gods be there? One.
What is God? An euerlaſting Spirit, immortall, inviſible,Eph. 4. 6. 1. Tim. 1. 17. Iohn. 4. 24. moſt ſtrong, onely wiſe.

p.hi: How many perſons are there?
Which be they?
How is God knowne?

div.p: By his workes, word and ſpirite.

p.hi: Who created the world?

div.p: God.

p.hi: Whereof did he create it?

div.p: Of nothing, and that by his word.

p.hi: Who made you?

div.p: God the Father.Gen. 1. 27. • . Cor. 8. 6.

p.hi: How did he create you?

div.p: In holineſſe and righteouſneſſe.

p.hi: Why were you thus created?

div.p: To glorifie him.

p.hi: Are you able to doe this of your ſelfe?
Why ſo?

div.p: Becauſe I am a ſinner.

p.hi: How come you to be a ſinner, ſeeing you were ſo perfectly created?

div.p: By the fall of Adam.Rom. • . 12. 1 • 19.

p.hi: What was his ſinne?

div.p: Diſobedience againſt God, in eating of theGen. • . • . Rom. • . 12. forbidden fruite.

p.hi: How commeth i • to paſſe, that you are become a ſinner in Adam?

div.p: Becauſe he was the Father of all mankinde.Rom. 5 12.

p.hi: How doe you proue that you are a ſinner?

div.p:
By the teſtimonie of mine own conſcience,Rom. 2. 1 • . • 3. •
▪ Gal. 3. • 9. and by the lawe of God.

p.hi: What is the lawe of God?

div.p: A perfect rule of righteouſnes commaundingPſal. 19. 7. good, and forbidding euill: the ſumme whereof is contained in the commaundements.

p.hi: How many be there?

div.p: Tenne.Exod 34. 〈◊〉 .

p.hi: Rehearſe them?

div.p: Then God ſpake all theſe words and ſaid. I am the Lord thy God, &c.
Are theſe wordes, I am the Lord thy God, &c. A commandement or preface?
A preface to the whole law.Leuit. 1 • . 2. 9.

p.hi: How be the commaundements deuided?

div.p: Into two tables or parts.Exod. 31. 1 • . & 34. 26▪

p.hi: How many be there of the first table?

div.p: Foure.

p.hi: How many of the ſecond?

div.p: Sixe.

p.hi: What doe the commaundements of the first table teach you?

div.p: My duetie towards God.Ma • . 22. 35.

p.hi: What doe the commaundements of the ſecond table teach you?

div.p:
My duetie towards my neighbour.
〈◊〉 . 22. • 9.

p.hi: Are you to vſe the commaundements as prayers?

div.p: No, becauſe they bee no petitions but commandements.

p.hi: Are you able to keep them, without breaking any one of them, in thought, word, or deede?

div.p: No.

p.hi: Why?

div.p: Becauſe I am readie & diſpoſed by nature,Eph. • . • . Rom. 3. 10. to offend both God and my neighbour.

p.hi: To what end then ſerueth the lawe?

div.p: To ſhew vs our miſerie, and ſo leade vs to Chriſt: and to bee a rule euer after for the well ordering of our liues.

p.hi: What is the puniſhment for the breach of the law?

div.p:
Eternall deſtruction both of body & ſoule.
• om. 6. 23.

p.hi: Is there no way to eſcape it, and be ſaued?

div.p: Yes.

p.hi: How?

div.p: By Ieſus Chriſt.Act. 4. •• .

p.hi: Who is this Christ?

div.p:
The ſonne of God, perfect God and perfectMat. 3. 17. Rom. 9. • . 〈◊〉
• . 9. • . Heb. 1. 6. man.

p.hi:
Could there no other meane, nor perſon bee found in Heauen or Earth, to ſaue you, but the ſonne of God must doe 〈◊〉
▪

div.p: No verely.

p.hi: Must he needes be God and man?

div.p: Yea.

p.hi: Why?

div.p: Firſt, becauſe hee muſt die for vs, and GodHeb. 9. 22. cannot die, therefore he muſt bee man.
Secondly, he muſt ouercome death, whichHeb. 2. 14. being onley man, he could not, therefore he muſt alſo be God.

p.hi: How did he ſaue you?

div.p: As he was man 1. Pet. 1. 1 • . & 2. 22. Heb. 4. 1 • . perfectly righteous, he performed the perfect obedience of the lawe, and ſatiſfied the 1 Pet. 2. 24. & 4. 1. 1. Pet. 3. 18. iuſtice of God for mee. And as he was God, he ouercame death, and rayſed vp his bodie the third day.

p.hi: Are all men partakers of this benefite of redemption purchaſed by Christ?

div.p: No, there are a number that ſhall haue their parte in hell with the diuel and his Angels.

p.hi: Who are they that haue their parte in the death of Christ?

div.p: Onely ſuch as truely beleeue.

p.hi: What is faith?

div.p: Faith, is Heb. 10. 22. Rom. 4. 20. 21. a full aſſurance of Iohn. 1. 12. my ſaluation in Ieſus Chriſt Act. 4. 12. alone.

p.hi: Hath euery man this faith in himſelfe?

div.p: No, for it is the 2. Theſ. 3. 2. Phil. 1. 29. gift of God, and not of Mat. 16. 17. nature.

p.hi: How is faith gotten?

div.p: By the outward hearing of the worde ofRom. 10. 17. 2. Cor. 1. 21. Acts. 2. 41. 2. Cor. 4. 1 • . Acts. 16. •• Iohn. 8. 31. & 6. 17. 1. Pet. 2. 2. God preached, and the inward working of the Spirite.

p.hi: How is it ſtrengthned & increaſed in you?

div.p: By the ſame preaching of the word, and the vſe of the Sacraments▪ and prayer.

p.hi: How ſhall a man know whether he haue this true and ſauing faith, or no?

div.p: By the fruites and markes thereof.

p.hi: What be the fruites of faith?

div.p: A hatred of all ſinne, a continuall care toAct • . 2. 37. Heb. 11. 7. Pſal. 119. 113. • . Iohn. 314. pleaſe God in the dueties commaunded, an vn • ained loue to Gods word and to his people.

p.hi: Rehearſe the ſumme of your Faith?

div.p: I beleeue in God the Father, &c.

p.hi: How many partes be there of this Creede?

div.p: Two.

p.hi: Which be they?

div.p: The firſt is of GOD, the ſecond is of the Church.

p.hi: Let vs now come to the meanes of ſtrengthning our faith, as of the Sacraments and prayer: and first what is a Sacrament?

div.p: A Sacrament is a ſeale and pledge of thoſe benefits of my ſaluation, which I receiue by Chriſt.

p.hi: How many Sacraments bee there in the Church of God?
Which be they?

div.p: Baptiſme, and the Supper of the Lord.1. Cor. 11. 23.

p.hi: Who ordayned them?

div.p: The Lord Ieſus.

p.hi: To what end?

div.p: To ſtrengthen our faith, and to further our repentance.

p.hi: How many things are to bee conſidered in a Sacrament?

div.p: Two.

p.hi: Which be they?

div.p: The ſigne, and the thing ſignified.

p.hi: In Baptiſme, which is the ſigne that may be ſeene?

div.p: Water.

p.hi: What is the thing ſignified?

div.p: The waſhing away of my ſins by the blood of Chriſt.

p.hi: How is your Faith ſtrongthened by Baptiſme?

div.p: By Baptiſme I am receiued into the familieMark. 16. 16. and congregation of the Lorde▪ and am thereby fully aſſured, that both my ſinnesAct. 2. 3 • . are forgiuen me, and the puniſhment due to the ſame.

p.hi: What doe you profeſſe in Baptiſme?

div.p: To die vnto ſinne, and to liue vnto righteouſneſſe.Rom. • . • .

p.hi: In the Supper of the Lorde, which bee the Signes that may be ſeene?
What doe they ſignifie?

div.p: The bodie and blood of Chriſt.

p.hi: How is your Faith ſtrengthned by the Supper of the Lord?

div.p: By the Supper of the Lorde my Faith is ſtrengthned, that as I receiue the bread and wine into my body to become mine: ſo doth my ſoule receiue withall Ieſus Chriſt▪ with all the benefites of his death to bee wholy mine.

p.hi: Is the bread and wine turned into the naturall bodie and blood of Christ, fleſh, blood, and bone?

div.p: No, the bread and wine of their owne nature are not changed, but in vſe they differ from other common bread & wine, becauſe they be appointed of God to bee ſignes of the bodie and blood of Chriſt.

p.hi: Why then doth Christ ſay▪ This is my body?

div.p:
It is a figuratiue ſpeech vſuall in the Scripture, as circumciſion is called the couenant,Gen. 10. 10. 11 Exod. 12. 11. the Lambe is called the paſſeouer: and yet
it is not the couenant, nor the paſſeouer, but a ſigne of it.

p.hi: How doe you eate Chriſts bodie, and drinke his blood?

div.p: Spiritually, and by Faith.Iohn. 6. 63.

p.hi: Are all perſons without exception to bee admitted to the Supper of the Lord?

div.p: No.

p.hi: Who are not to be admitted?

div.p: Children, Fooles, Mad-men, Ignorant perſons,1. Cor. 11. 2 • . Tit. 3. 10. knowne heretikes, open and notorious ſinners not repenting.

p.hi: What must he doe that will 〈◊〉 worthily to the ſupper of the Lord?

div.p: He muſt proue and examine himſelfe.1. Cor. 11. 28. 29.

p.hi: Wherein muſt he examine himſelfe?

div.p: Firſt, what knowledge he hath in the principles of Religion, and eſpecially in the matter of the Sacrament.
Secondly, whether hee hath true • aith in Ieſus Chriſt, or no.

Thirdly, whether he be penitent and •• rie for his ſinnes paſt, purpoſing to leaue them,Mat. • . 23. Rom. 12. 18. Heb. 12. 14. and to liue godlie, endeuouring himſelfe to be in brotherly loue & charity with al men.

p.hi:
Then it ſeemeth there bee ſome, • h •
〈◊〉 they come, yet they looſe the benefite of this communion in themſelues?

div.p: Yea.

p.hi: Who be they?

div.p: Such as come not in Faith, and are not grieued for their ſinnes paſt, as hypocrites, ciuill men, Church Papiſts, priuie enemies to Gods word, and ſo many of the godlie as1. Cor. 11. 30. 2. Chro. 30. 18 come not ſufficiently prepared, procure a puniſhment.

p.hi: What is the other helpe you haue to increaſe Faith?

div.p: Prayer.

p.hi: What is prayer?

div.p:
Prayer, is a ſpirituall action of Faith wherein
〈◊〉 . 8. 26. • am. 1. 6. • . Iohn. 5. 14. we require of God in the name of Chriſt, all things neceſſarie, his glorie and our comfort.

p.hi: To whome must you Pray?

div.p: To God only.

p.hi: In whoſe name?

div.p: In the name of Chriſt.

p.hi: Then you may not pray to Saincts, or Angels,
or to God in the name of a Saint or Angell?

div.p: No.

p.hi: Wh •• ?

div.p: Becauſe there is neither commandement, promiſe, nor example in the Scripture for it.

p.hi: How must you pray?

div.p: As Chriſt hath taught me, ſaying:Mat. 6. • .
Our Father which art, &c.

p.hi: How many petitions be there in this prayer?

div.p: Sixe, three concerning the glorie of God, and three our owne neceſſities.

p.hi: What are theſe words, Our Father which are in heauen?

div.p: A preface or introduction to the prayer.

p.hi: What are theſe words: For thine is the kingdome, the power and glorie for euer?

div.p: The concluſion of the prayer.

p.hi: What doe you owe to God for all his benefites?

div.p: Thankeſgiuing.Pſal. 1 • 6. 12. • 3.

p.hi: Is it enough that you thanke him with your • lips alone?

div.p: No, but I muſt be obedient to his lawes and commaundements: which grace the Lord graunt.

div.head: Sundry neceſſarie obſeruations for a Christian.
